alert.note: Alert for Uinta (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 28 at 3:37AM MST until February 28 at 4:45AM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Central Uinta County in southwestern Wyoming... * Until 445 AM MST * At 335 AM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located 7 miles east of Evanston, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 through all of Uinta County. Locations impacted include... Evanston, Lyman, Mountain View, Ragen, Millburne, Church Buttes, Fort Bridger, Altamont, Piedmont, Carter and Leroy. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED
